AB: As adult-generated neurons integrate into hippocampal circuits, they compete with mature neurons for inputs from the entorhinal cortex. By reducing spines on mature granule cells, McAvoy et al. (2016) find that new neurons integrate more efficiently, and this facilitates learning.
